data.name: ChooseLocation_Description
data.value: Please choose the folder that {0} will be installed into. If the folder already exists, all contents will be removed without backup.

data.name: ChooseLocation_Description_Uninstall
data.value: Please choose the folder to uninstall {0} from. All folder contents will be removed without backup.

data.name: ChooseLocation_Description_Upgrade
data.value: Please choose the folder of the existing {0} installation to upgrade.

data.name: ChooseLocation_Intro
data.value: Please choose the location where ValidationMaster will be installed:

data.name: Confirmation_Description
data.value: The details and tasks to be performed are summarized below. Click the '{0}' button to begin the process. If you need to make changes to any of the setting below, use the 'Back' button.

data.name: DatabaseServer_ConnectFailure
data.value: Failed to connect to database server, error was '{0}'

data.name: DatabaseServer_ConnectFailureLoginPassword
data.value: Unable to login with the provided username and password.\nPlease check the login and password and try again\r\n (Error Message: '{0}')

data.name: DatabaseServer_ConnectFailureServerInstanceNotFound
data.value:
Unable to connect to the database server.

Please make sure that the database server name is correct and that you have included the instance name if needed. (e.g. SQL Server express edition has a server name of MachineName\SQLEXPRESS)

(Error Message: '{0}')

data.name: DatabaseServer_Intro
data.value: The installer will now help you connect to the SQL Server database that ValidationMaster is to be installed on.

data.name: DatabaseServer_Introduction
data.value: Please enter the name of the database server and the login/password for a system-administration level account that will be used to create the database and associated database objects:

data.name: DatabaseServer_LoginNotSysAdmin
data.value: The database login you have chosen is not a system administrator of the database. It will not be able to create the necessary database objects. Please try again using a 'sysadmin' level account.

data.name: DatabaseServer_PasswordNoSemiColons
data.value: You cannot use database passwords that contain semicolons

data.name: DatabaseServer_ServerNoTrailingSlash
data.value: The database server name cannot end in a backslash

data.name: DatabaseServer_ServerRequired
data.value: You need to provide a SQL Server instance!

data.name: DatabaseServer_SQLLoginRequired
data.value: You need to provide a SQL Server login!

data.name: DatabaseServer_UnableToDetectDatabaseRole
data.value: Unable to detect database user's role. You can proceed with installation, but it may fail.

data.name: DatabaseServer_UnableToDetectDatabaseVersion
data.value: Unable to detect database version. You can proceed with installation, but it may fail.

data.name: DatabaseServer_VersionTooOld
data.value: Your database server is running an incompatible version of MS SQL Server. This application needs '{0}' or greater to be installed.

data.name: Eula_AcceptEula
data.value: I accept the terms of the End User License Agreement

data.name: Eula_Intro
data.value: Please read the following OnShore Technology Group, Inc. End User License Agreement (EULA) carefully:

data.name: InstallationType_AddApplicationNode
data.value: Add a ValidationMaster Application Server to a Clustered Instance

data.name: InstallationType_CleanInstall
data.value: Installs a new version of ValidationMaster on this computer

data.name: InstallationType_Intro
data.value: Please choose the setup that best suits your needs:

data.name: InstallationType_Upgrade
data.value: Upgrades an older version of ValidationMaster already installed

data.name: Introduction_Legend
data.value: Welcome to the ValidationMaster installation wizard. This wizard will walk you through the steps to install ValidationMaster on your server. The installer can also upgrade an existing installation of ValidationMaster or add an additional ValidationMaster application node to a clustered installation.

data.name: LicenseKey_Intro
data.value: Please enter the organization and license key exactly as listed in your OnShore Technology Group, Inc. customer area.

data.name: LicenseKey_LicenseIsExpired
data.value: The provided license key has expired. Please contact OnShore Technology Group, Inc. Sales as soon as possible to get a new license key.

data.name: LicenseKey_LicenseIsInvalid
data.value: The provided license key is invalid. Please make sure you have entered the Organization Name and License Key exactly as they appear in the OnShore Technology Group, Inc. Customer Area

data.name: Prerequisites_Intro
data.value: Checking to make sure the prerequisites are installed. Please refer to the installation guide for further details.

data.name: Procedure_Description
data.value: This wizard will install ValidationMaster from OnShore Technology Group, Inc. onto your server.

data.name: Results_Message
data.value: Installation of {0} was completed successfully. You can start the application by opening the {0} program entry on the Start Menu.

data.name: WebServer_ExistingVirtualDirectoryIntro1
data.value: Please choose the IIS virtual directory that you want to be uninstalled:

data.name: WebServer_ExistingVirtualDirectoryIntro2
data.value: Please choose the IIS virtual directory that you want to be upgraded:

data.name: WebServer_Intro
data.value: The installer will now let you choose how the product is installed on your IIS web server:

data.name: WebServer_NewVirtualDirectoryIntro
data.value: Please enter the name of the IIS virtual directory that you want to use with ValidationMaster. Leaving it will blank will install ValidationMaster directly under the Website itself:

data.name: WebServer_WebSiteIntro
data.value: Please choose the IIS website that you want to install ValidationMaster onto:

data.name: DatabaseBackup_Description
data.value: Please choose the location where {0} will be backed up to:

data.name: Eula_AcceptToContinue
data.value: You need to accept the End User License Agreement (EULA) to Proceed!

data.name: ChooseLocation_InstallationFolderAlreadyExists
data.value: The install folder already exists. Contents will be deleted before installation.

data.name: ChooseLocation_InstallationFolderDoesNotExist
data.value: The chosen folder '{0}' cannot be upgraded or uninstalled because it does not exist!

data.name: ChooseLocation_InstallationFolderNotEntered
data.value: Please enter the name of the folder you want to install {0} into!

data.name: ChooseLocation_InstallationFolderNoWebConfig
data.value: The chosen folder '{0}' cannot be upgraded or uninstalled because there is no '{1}' installation in that folder.

data.name: InstallationType_NoOptionChosen
data.value: Please choose an installation option to continue!

data.name: WebServer_NeedToProvideApplicationPoolName
data.value: Please enter the name of the application pool you want to create for {0}

data.name: WebServer_ApplicationNameAlreadyInUse
data.value: The application name selected for {0} is already in use, please use another name and try again!

data.name: DatabaseBackup_BackupFileAlreadyExists
data.value: The specified backup file '{0}' already exists, please choose a different name and try again!

data.name: DatabaseBackup_FilenameIncorrectExtension
data.value: The backup filename '{0}' needs to have a .bak file extension!

data.name: DatabaseBackup_FilenameNotEntered
data.value: You need to enter the name of a backup file for the {0} database!

data.name: DatabaseBackup_FolderPathDoesNotExist
data.value: The specified backup directory '{0}' does not exist!

data.name: DatabaseServer_CannotUseNewLoginConflicts
data.value: You cannot create a new login named '{0}' as it will conflict with the login you specified to perform the installation with.

data.name: DatabaseServer_ConnectSuccessWithAppPoolWarning
data.value: You are using Windows Authentication to connect to a remote database server, you will need to change the Application Pool identity to a Windows Domain User after installation.

data.name: DatabaseServer_DatabaseNameAlreadyExists
data.value: Cannot create the database '{0}' as a database by this name already exists. Please enter a different name and try again!

data.name: DatabaseServer_DatabaseNameDoesNotExist
data.value: Cannot upgrade, connect to, or uninstall the database '{0}' as no database exists by this name. Please double-check the server and login/password then try again!

data.name: DatabaseServer_InvalidVersionofDatabaseSchema
data.value: You cannot upgrade the '{0}' database, it is not running a supported version of '{1}'.

data.name: Thread_CompletedMessage
data.value: Successfully completed the installation of {0} on this computer.

data.name: Thread_Completed_UninstallMessage
data.value: Successfully completed the uninstallation of {0} on this computer.

data.name: Global_Tagline
data.value: a complete Quality Assurance and Project Management suite.

data.name: DatabaseServer_DatabaseNameAlreadyExists_Simple
data.value: An application's database already exists. If you are trying to upgrade, go back to the Install Type screen and select an upgrade option. Otherwise, remove the database '{0}' and try again.

data.name: DatabaseBackup_Intro1
data.value: Set up the database backup options below.

data.name: DatabaseBackup_Intro3
data.value: If entering a custom location, make sure that the path exists on the database server, and that the database process can write to the path. Uninstallation will continue even if backup creation fails.

data.name: DatabaseBackup_Filename1
data.value: The filename of the backup in the above directory will be '

data.name: Confirmation_UninstallNoDBBackup
data.value: WARNING: The database will not be backed up. All data in it will be lost when the database is removed!

data.name: Confirmation_UpgradeNoDBBackup
data.value: WARNING: The database will not be backed up. Data may be lost if the upgrade process fails!

data.name: Progress_DBUpgrade_WrongVersionMaximum
data.value: Database is already version {0}. It cannot be upgraded to a higher version.

data.name: Progress_DBUpgrade_WrongVersionMinimum
data.value: Database is currently version {0}. It must be at least {1} to upgrade to {2}.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorAppSettings
data.value: Could not update application settings with new setting. Log in to the application and verify Global Settings are correct.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorBkpDatabase
data.value: There was an error trying to back up the database. The {1} could not continue. Check hard drive space, and user permissions, then try the {1} again.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorUpgApplFiles
data.value: Could not properly copy the new application files into the install directory. Make sure there are no open files in the directory and that disk space is not limited, then run upgrade again.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorUpgDatabase
data.value: There was an error upgrading the database. Restore the backup that was created, and try the upgrade again.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorWebConfig
data.value: Could not update the application's configration. Please inform support if you cannot connect to the application.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorInsDatabase
data.value: Could not create the database or database objects.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorInsFiles
data.value: Could not copy files into installation directory.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorInsRollback
data.value: The application could not be installed. {0} Try installation again. If you continue to have issues, contact support.

data.name: InstallResult_Message_ErrorInsWebObj
data.value: Could not create the IIS Server Web Objects.

data.name: Upgrade_NewerVersion
data.value: The application installed is a newer version than this installer. You cannot downgrade the current installation.

data.name: Upgrade_SameVersion
data.value: The applicaiton is already at version v{0} - there is no need to upgrade. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: Upgrade_WrongVersion
data.value: The version installed is older than v5.4. It must be upgraded to the latest v5.4 version before you can upgrade to v6.x.

data.name: Global_LogLocation
data.value: For additional information, the log can be found in C:\ProgramData\OnShore\ValidationMaster
